# Developed with AI assistance, 99.9% of the code generated by AI, completed using Code Buddy

> Frontend and backend separation, frontend uses Vue 2 + Element UI + vue-element-admin
> Backend uses MyBatis Plus, JDK 17, Spring Boot

# RBAC Permission Management System - Frontend

A permission management system frontend based on Vue 2 + Element UI.

## Tech Stack

- Vue 2.6.14
- Vue Router 3.5.3
- Vuex 3.6.2
- Element UI 2.15.13
- Axios 0.27.2

## Project Structure

```
www/
├── public/                # Static assets
├── src/
│   ├── api/              # API interfaces
│   ├── components/       # Common components
│   ├── filters/          # Global filters
│   ├── layout/           # Layout components
│   ├── router/           # Router configuration
│   ├── store/            # Vuex state management
│   ├── styles/           # Global styles
│   ├── utils/            # Utility functions
│   ├── views/            # Page components
│   ├── App.vue           # Root component
│   ├── main.js           # Entry file
│   └── permission.js     # Permission control
├── .env.development      # Development environment config
├── .env.production       # Production environment config
├── vue.config.js         # Vue CLI configuration
├── babel.config.js       # Babel configuration
└── package.json          # Project dependencies
```

## Features

- User Management: CRUD operations for users, password reset
- Role Management: CRUD operations for roles, assign menu permissions and data permissions
- Menu Management: CRUD operations for menus, tree view display
- Department Management: CRUD operations for departments, tree view display
- Login Authentication: JWT token authentication, permission control

## Development

```bash
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Start development server (http://localhost:9527)
npm run dev
```

## Build

```bash
# Production build
npm run build:prod

# Staging build
npm run build:stage
```

## Notes

1. Default backend API address: `http://localhost:8080/api`
2. Modify development environment config in `.env.development`
3. Modify production environment config in `.env.production`
4. Default login credentials: admin / admin123

## API Documentation

All APIs return a unified format:
```json
{
  "code": 200,
  "msg": "success",
  "data": {}
}
```

Token is passed through the `Authorization` request header.
